posts.post_content:
A lot of people complain about the mana cost being seven mana. What, I ask you, is a good mana cost for a 4/4 that has protection from creatures and punishes your opponents for attacking you? If the mana cost is really that big of a deal, play [Heartless Summoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartless Summoning) and live with the fact that she'll be a 3/3. If you're playing Orzhov in standard, you probably at least one [Crypt Ghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crypt Ghast) anyway, so paying the mana cost shouldn't be a problem to most Orzhov players.   
  
However, if I really wanted a fatty in an Orzhov standard deck RIGHT NOW (aside from [Obzedat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obzedat)), I'd still go with [Griselbrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Griselbrand) over Teysa. Griselbrand is a monster that will allow you to blow out games in combo with the [Vizkopa Guildmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vizkopa Guildmage) or beat your opponents on its own, and will give you card advantage for a price that most Orzhov players should be more then content to pay. Griselbrand may cost more then Teysa, but for the ti... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: alzabo (6/13/2013 6:36:30 AM)

posts.post_content:
The flavour actually makes perfect sense if you think about it. Teysa isn't a combatant; she's a commander!  
  
She has 4 power because she sends a debtor with 4 power after you. She has 4 toughness because she has a bunch of debtors protecting her. She has vigilance and protection from creatures because she isn't actually *on* the battlefield; rather, she attacks and blocks through the various spirits she has under contract.  
  
And the mana cost? She's the official spokesperson for the Orzhov guild: you think she doesn't have anything better to do than sort your problems out for you?
posts.html:

And the mana cost? She's the official spokesperson for the Orzhov guild: you think she doesn't have anything better to do than sort your problems out for you?

Posted By: Lazyblazey (7/14/2013 5:43:06 PM)
Rating:

@BenCheshire: The "combat damage to you" means that you the player lost life as a result of combat. The creatures are only destroyed and tokens created if you take a hit yourself either by not blocking, by trample damage to you or from "Super Trample" (Deals damage as though it was not blocked).

A quick word for people on what "Protection from creatures" entitles you, since it seems many players don't fully understand protection. Any damage that would be dealt to Teysa by a creature, either from combat or from abilities of that creature is prevented. (as are any effects that would be reliant on that damage being dealt) Additionally any abilities creatures have that use the word "target" cannot choose her as a target, this includes the abilities of your own creatures. (e.g. Gigantomancer) She cannot be blocked by creatures, making her unblockable. The other effect of protection (Preventing enchantment/equipping by protected sources) is generally irrelevent.

I am ... (see all)

posts.post_content: @BenCheshire: You means you, not your creatures. Any card that says "you" is referencing the player, not your cards or permanents. Any card that says something like "an opponent" is referencing that player, not their cards/permanents.
posts.html:
@BenCheshire: You means you, not your creatures. Any card that says "you" is referencing the player, not your cards or permanents. Any card that says something like "an opponent" is referencing that player, not their cards/permanents.

posts.post_content:
A cool control option for Black/White EDH. They could have made her 6 mana though (with less P/T).  
  
Combined with extort, you can afford to take hits here and there, and you will get chump blockers/attackers out of it. It's not a strong option as a general, but it is a cool one for sure.
